    • Method Detail

      • createScore

        public void createScore(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<ScoreResponse>> callback)
        Create a score. The response object will contain a series of coded messages detailing what items were completed, the score registered, and any tickets allocated. Scoring a level could complete the pack it is in, completing that pack could complete the game, which in turn could complete the mission. This completion chain is indicated to the client via a list of MessageResponse. The list of message codes are:
        • 3001 - total score of mission (sum of all game scores)
        • 3007 - mission has been completed
        • 4001 - total score of game (sum of all pack scores)
        • 4002 - game has been completed
        • 5001 - total score of pack (sum of all level scores)
        • 5002 - pack has been completed
        • 6001 - total score of level
        • 6002 - level has been completed
        • 6006 - tickets were allocated for score


        Target API Endpoint: /score/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The game application key to save the score for.
        • SirqulKeys.missionId
          The missionId to score for, ignore if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.gameId
          The gameId to score for, ignore if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.packId
          The packId to score for, send -2 if playing community levels.
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelId
          The gameLevelId to score for.
        • SirqulKeys.gameObjectId
          The gameObjectId to score for, ignore if level based scoring.
        • SirqulKeys.points
          The score
        • SirqulKeys.timeTaken
          The time taken to complete task

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< ScoreResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ScoreApiBase.createScore

      • getScore

        public void getScore(Map<String,Object> params,
            ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<ScoreResponse>> callback)
        Get the high score for an item. Pass in the full path IDs for the score.

        Target API Endpoint: /score/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The game application key to get the level for.
        • SirqulKeys.missionId
          The missionId to score for, null if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.gameId
          The gameId to score for, null if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.packId
          The packId to score for, null if playing community levels.
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelId
          The gameLevelId to score for.
        • SirqulKeys.gameObjectId
          The gameObjectId to score for, null if level based scoring.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< ScoreResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ScoreApiBase.getScore

      • searchScores

        public void searchScores(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<List<ScoreResponse>>> callback)
        Get the scores for an item. Pass in the full path IDs for the scores.

        Target API Endpoint: /score/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The game application key to get the level for.
        • SirqulKeys.missionId
          The missionId to score for, null if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.gameId
          The gameId to score for, null if not playing mission.
        • SirqulKeys.packId
          The packId to score for, null if playing community levels.
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelId
          The gameLevelId to score for.
        • SirqulKeys.gameObjectId
          The gameObjectId to score for, null if level based scoring.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< ScoreResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ScoreApiBase.searchScores
